<title level="1" right="Rules">[Gathering the Components](/Rules.aspx?ID=1948)</title>

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 172 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
Locating the individual crafting quest components for a single story-crafted item should occur in separate and distinct areas, even if they're all in one larger location (like a dungeon or one large forest). This makes the item feel like it was earned, rather than given, and prevents the characters from exceeding the normal time limits that are a part of the crafting process.

 Each component should be either a part of the final item or something used during the creation process itself. For example, if you were trying to create a powerful bow that calls upon storms, you might need to find the heart of a tree burned by lightning, the scale of a [blue dragon](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=166), or even the breath of a powerful [air elemental](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=41). Alternatively, the component might be a person or place necessary for the crafting, like a woodcarver who survived a shipwreck, or a workshop located atop a mountain. In any event, each component should feel like it's building toward a completed item as part of the well-rounded story that tells of its creation.
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
